meanings.definition: Unable to be seen; not visible.
meanings.sent1: The ghost was invisible to everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: The magician made the rabbit disappear, becoming invisible to the audience.
meanings.sent3: The invisible ink revealed a secret message when heated.
meanings.sent4: Her pain was like an invisible weight on her shoulders, dragging her down.
meanings.sent5: The ninja moved with invisible grace, blending into the shadows effortlessly.

meanings.sent1: The treasure was invisible beneath the thick foliage.
meanings.sent2: The spy remained invisible in the crowd, observing without being noticed.
meanings.sent3: The invisible cookies mysteriously disappeared from the jar overnight.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were like invisible walls, keeping others from getting too close.
meanings.sent5: The moon was invisible behind the dark clouds, shrouded in mystery.

meanings.sent1: The ultraviolet light was invisible to the naked eye.
meanings.sent2: The scent of the flower was invisible but still delightful.
meanings.sent3: The invisible force of gravity kept us grounded on Earth.
meanings.sent4: His influence was like an invisible hand guiding our decisions.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the wind was invisible, but its presence was felt in the rustling leaves.
